alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 29 at 3:34PM MST until June 29 at 4:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 430 PM MST. * At 334 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near White Tank Mountain Park to near Beardsley to near Peoria to near Arrowhead Mall to Deer Valley Airport to Salt River Indian Community to near Mesa to near Apache Junction to 6 miles south of Gold Canyon to Florence Junction, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 110 and 113. AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 211 and 227. AZ Route 51 between mile markers 6 and 15. Locations impacted include... Phoenix, Mesa, Glendale, Scottsdale, Gilbert, Tempe, Peoria, Surprise, Buckeye, Apache Junction, Fountain Hills, Paradise Valley, East Mesa, Wittmann and Gold Canyon. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
